meanings.definition: Used to indicate that something is not important or worth further consideration.
meanings.sent1: The color of the pen is nevermind; what matters is if it writes well.
meanings.sent2: She decided to wear her favorite dress, nevermind the weather outside.
meanings.sent3: The missing puzzle piece was nevermind compared to the joy of completing the puzzle.
meanings.sent4: His broken toy was nevermind in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the cake was nevermind once she saw the beautiful decorations.

meanings.definition: Used to tell someone not to be concerned or worried about something.
meanings.sent1: Nevermind, the cat will find its way back home.
meanings.sent2: Nevermind, I can handle this on my own.
meanings.sent3: Nevermind, the rain won't ruin our picnic.
meanings.sent4: Nevermind, we'll figure out a solution together.
meanings.sent5: Nevermind, everything will work out in the end.
